risk_factors.reasoning: Drug use has been shown to increase the likelihood of criminal behavior and reoffending.
A history of arrests and convictions is a strong predictor of future criminal behavior.
Being an 18-year-old male may make the person more susceptible to risky behaviors, but it is not as strong of a predictor as other factors.
While race and ethnicity can play a role in criminal behavior, they are not as strong of predictors as other factors such as arrest history and drug use.
Being unmarried or living alone does not necessarily increase the likelihood of reoffending, but it may be a factor in some cases.
Having a GED certificate is better than not having any education at all, but it may not be as strong of a predictor as other factors such as arrest history and drug use.
Holding one job during the year is not necessarily a risk factor for reoffending.
Feeling depressed over the past month is not a strong predictor of criminal behavior, but it may be a factor in some cases.
Growing up in an urban area with both biological parents may have some impact on criminal behavior, but it is not as strong of a predictor as other factors such as arrest history and drug use.
Believing that God has something to do with what happens to one personally may be a factor in some cases, but it is not as strong of a predictor as other factors such as arrest history and drug use.
